snippet: Christine C. Quinn, the City Council speaker, proposed burying electrical wires in flood-prone areas and building protection around power plants.
abstract: New York City Council Speaker Christine C Quinn becomes first 2013 mayoral contender to talk about the devastating impact of Hurricane Sandy, proposing a series of stormproofing steps and calling for acceleration of a host of city and federal studies on the feasibility of storm surge barriers, which she said could cost $16 billion.
lead_paragraph: Christine C. Quinn, the City Council speaker, proposed burying electrical wires in flood-prone areas and building protection around power plants.

headline.seo: Council Speaker Quinn Urges Steps to Protect Against Hurricanes
headline.main: Council Speaker Urges Stormproofing as the Civic Conversation Shifts
headline.print_headline: Council Speaker Urges Stormproofing as the Political Conversation Shifts

keywords.value: Assn for a Better New York
keywords.name: organizations
